skillTree.localised_description: More flesh for the feasting means more punishing magic for Skrag's foolish enemies!

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +10% when increasing
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +20% when increasing
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +30% when increasing

skillTree.localised_description: Regular consumption of rotten meat and toxins are the staples of a healthy Ogre diet.
The reeking odour seeping from this one's every pore would offend any creature with a nose, and several without.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: As menial slaves to the Butcher's bidding, these Gnoblars must find him meat for the pot, or wind up in it themselves.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +5% when increasing

skillTree.localised_description: Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Fetch me more bones! This meal could use a little crunch!"
Not even the darkest corruption can escape the Maw's devouring influence.
The Slaughtermaster speaks as the Great Maw wills, and all of the faithful listen well.
"Kill a creature with poison and it seeps into their skin – gives that yummy flesh an extra kick!"

effects.description:
Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The best part of such rampant slaughter is the gory feast that follows.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Fate of Bjuna"
Overcast spell: "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Unlike most other ogres, Slaughtermasters understand that supplies are needed to keep the tribe fed and ready to fight during their long travels.
Gnoblars have two jobs in a Slaughtermaster´s army: finding food for their masters or being eaten. So the strongest ones end ambushing some relatives and putting them in the stew.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +4% for Gnoblars, Lucky Gits, Blood Gnoblars (Spears) units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +3 for Gnoblars, Lucky Gits, Blood Gnoblars, and Gnoblar Trappers units

skillTree.localised_description: Gorgers and many Ogres lack patience and intelligence, and are always eager to charge against any tasty creature they see, confident in that their strength an weight is all they need to win.

Charge Bonus +4 for Bulls, Skull Rocks, and Gorgers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +4% for Bulls, Skull Rocks, and Gorgers units

skillTree.localised_name: Gold Is Glitter, But Iron Is Harder
skillTree.localised_description: A heavy armour is the sign of a wealthy and healthy ogre who has fought and devoured uncounted enemies.

effects.description:
Armour: +4 for Ironguts, Ironskin Ogres, and All Cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These Ogres and their Gnoblar pets have traveled around the world, eating all manner of creatures, and now return  to bore their tribe-mates with long war stories that can even be true.

skillTree.localised_description: Hunting the biggest and most ferocious creatures to tame them or eating them is one of the most respected trades an Ogre can choose.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +4% for Sons of the Mountain, Sabretusks, Stonehorns, and Giants units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence +4 for Sons of the Mountain, Sabretusks, Stonehorns, and Giants units

skillTree.localised_description: Slaughtermasters roam around the world and learn anything that can be used to get more food for his tribe and the Maw. Some of them stay with the Angry Fists tribe for a while and learn from them the secrets of the proper use of gunpowder.

effects.description:
Reload Time Reduction: +6% for Ironblasters, Leadbelchers, and Firebelchers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload Time Reduction: +9% for Ironblasters, Leadbelchers, and Firebelchers units
	(Lord's army)

Reload Time Reduction: +12% for Ironblasters, Leadbelchers, and Firebelchers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Ironguts, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Ironguts, Gnoblars and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +15% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +7 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the Maneaters feast on the flesh of the fallen.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +7 for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Maneaters, Gorgers and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
The mysterious powers of the Great Maw can heal even the deepest of wounds.
Ogres flock to this Butcher's camp, eager for the chance to witness the Great Maw's malevolent power.
This ravening Ogre Lord is but a mere symbol of his god, whose cancerous power reigns over the Mountains of Mourn.
The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
Through a bloody haze of visions, the Butcher sees a great many terrible wonders.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Flesh, limbs, blood and bone – it all goes into the meat-pot!
Wealth is much easier to come by when the omens are guiding your path.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
Butchery is an art. This one knows how to extract every last morsel worth eating from a carcass, leaving only bones behind them.
Though they risk killing the Ogres directly behind them, those fighters who like it spicy can propel themselves further with gassy emanations following a hearty meal.
The more meat you eat, the stronger and fatter you become, and therefore the harder you are to move from your chosen position.
There may or may not be a height difference between this one and his Ogreish colleagues, but in stature on the battlefield the divergence is most stark.
"Remember, lads, when Great Maw came 'e ate the night, shook the ground and burnt it with fire. That is 'oo we serve, not sum uvver power."
